Cora Maurelina habita en Nueva Guinea, es casada, madre de un niño de un año, labora como docente de secundaria.

Solicita el crédito para realizar compra de materiales de construcción para mejorar la sala de su vivienda, de esta forma mejorará la calidad de vida del núcleo familiar, su mayor deseo es mejorar su propiedad y tener mayor seguridad.
texts.en:
Cora Maurelina lives in Nueva Guinea.  She is married, the mother of a one-year-old son and works as a secondary school teacher.

She is requesting a loan to buy construction materials to fix up her living room.  This will improve the family's quality of life.  Her greatest desire is to improve her property and make it safer.

loans.use: To fix up her living room.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa Elvira tiene 42 años de edad vive en el distrito de Cayaltí, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, que se encuentra ubicado en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de verduras soya y gaseosas, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio, es una mujer emprendedora, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 300 nuevos soles para la compra de tomate, cebolla, pepino, gaseosa, para ampliar su negocio y su respectiva venta atendiendo la demanda de su comunidad y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa Elvira, 42, lives in the district of Cayaltí where the local people are involved in agriculture, commerce and livestock farming.  It is located in the province of Chiclayo which belongs to the Lambayeque Region along the northern coast of Peru.

She sells vegetables, soy and sodas.  Her business is set up at home and she is a very enterprising woman.  The loan she is requesting in the amount of 1,300 PEN will be used to buy tomatoes, onions, cucumbers and sodas to expand her business.  This way she will be able to meet the demand in her community and generate more income to lead a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy oniones, tomatoes and fruit to expand her business.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo tiene 27 años de edad, vive con su esposa e hijo en el Caserío Vista Alegre, una zona rural del distrito de Callayuc que se caracteriza por sus bosques verdes tiene un relieve accidentado, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, que pertenece a la Provincia de Cutervo, ubicado en la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura cultivando café desde hace siete años, es un padre emprendedor que junto a su esposa se esfuerzan en la labor que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para el mantenimiento de su cultivo con la compra de abono y pago de mano de obra a jornaleros.
texts.en:
Alfredo, 27, lives with his wife and son in the Vista Alegre rural community in the district of Callayuc.  It is known for its green forests and rugged terrain.  The local people are involved in agriculture, commerce and livestock farming.  It is in the province of Cutervo in the Cajamarca Region along the northern coast of Peru.

Alfredo is a farmer who has grown coffee for the last seven years.  He is an enterprising father who, alongside his wife, works hard on the job.  He is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN for crop maintenance.  He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and to hire workers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his coffee crop and hire workers.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Emprendedoras está en su ciclo número 27 del programa de comité de mujeres, es un grupo antiguo, que gracias a las capacitaciones y charlas en las que participan mejoraron bastante. También forman parte del programa de eliminación de pobreza, y gracias al cual han mejorado mucho.
Una persona que se destaca en este grupo es la Sra. Joaquina, quien es la presidenta de este grupo, y comenta que todas ponen su mayor esfuerzo siempre, que se ayudan y asi están mejorado su estilo de vida. Ella es una mujer muy dedicada a su familia, y comenta que se dedica a la costura, ya que es modista, y que pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, e hilos para seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres Emprededoras" is in its 27th loan cycle through the women entrepreneurs program.  It is an old group which, through training and workshops, has allowed the members to improve considerably.  They also participate in the povery elimination program which has helped them too.

One of the members who stands out in the group is Joaquina, the president.  She says the members always work their hardest to help each other and improve their lifestyles.  She is a woman who is very dedicated to her family.  She is a seamstress and is requesting a loan to buy fabric and thread to continue her business.

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Ana Rosa

texts.es:
Ana Rosa tiene 23 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijo en el distrito de Cayalti, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de alimentos preparados chanfainita, hígado, caldo verde, chaufa entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en el mercado de la zona, es una madre emprendedora, ha solicitado un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de platos descartables, cubiertos, vasos, servilletas entre otros y de esta manera tener el servicios de cocina disponible para despachar sus alimentos.
texts.en:
Ana Rosa, 23, lives with her husband and son in the district of Cayalti.  The local people are involved in agriculture, commerce and livestock farming.  It is in the province of Chiclayo which belongs to the Lambayeque Region along the northern coast of Peru.

She sells food such as chainfainita (cooked pork in sauce), liver, green consomé, and fried rice and meat, among other dishes.  Her stand is located in the local market.  She is an enterprising mother who is requesting a loan of 500 PEN to buy disposable plates, utensils and napkins to serve the food she makes.

loans.use: To buy disposable plates and utensils for her food business.

loans.name: Luz Estela

texts.es: En el año 2003, con la necesidad de aportar ingresos para su hogar y apoyar la gestión de bienestar de su hogar, hasta ese momento solo en manos de su cónyuge, quien había perdido su trabajo, Luz Estela, mujer de 36 años y madre de 2 hijos en las edades de 10 y 15 años, decidió aprovechar todo el conocimiento de panadería, que por herencia tenia su cónyuge y emprendió su propia aventura emprendedora, elaborando y vendiendo productos de panadería.  Hoy tiene una gran oferta de productos deliciosos, entre croissant, galletas, tornillos rellenos, panochas y diversidad de panes que ofrece al público, en su propio domicilio, vendiendo tienda a tienda, de contado y a crédito. Su horario laboral es desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche, todos los días de la semana sin cesar. Su meta mas adelante es tener un local, para desagregar su espacio familiar, de su tarea productiva diaria y ofrecer un mayor confort a sus hijos en su vivienda y sacarlos adelanté en sus estudios. Pero su mayor desafío es obtener un capital de trabajo suficiente, para afrontar la demanda y esta es justamente la razón, por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará harina de trigo, huevos, queso, vitina, frutas cristalizadas, entre otros insumos, para hacer su mayor oferta  en la temporada de fin de año, época en la cual se incrementan sus ventas y por consiguiente sus utilidades, haciendo así, de su credikiva una inversión exitosa.
texts.en:
Luz Estela, 36, is married and has two children, ages 10 and 15.  In 2003, she had to start working in order to help cover household expenses because her husband, who had been the sole income earner, lost his job.  She decided to take advantage of her baking knowledge, which came form her husband, and started her own baking business.

Nowadays, she sells a wide range of delicious products including croissants, cookies, cream-puffs, and other pastries.  She sells from home and also to stores, on both a cash and credit basis.  Her work schedule is 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. every day of the week.  Her goal is to have her own shop, away from the home so her children are more comfortable and able to study.

Her greatest challenge is having enough capital to meet the demand for her products.  So, she is requesting a CrediKiva loan, her first through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation.  She will use it to buy flour, eggs, cheese, shortening, candied fruits, etc. to have more stock for the New Year season.  It is a time when both sales and profits increase, making the CrediKiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, shortening, candied fruit, etc.

loans.name: Jesus Maria

texts.es:
Jesus María tiene 35 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo en el Caserío La Toma, una zona rural del distrito de Buenos Aires, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, que pertenece a la Provincia de Piura y Región del mismo nombre, ubicado en la costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como arroz, leche, azúcar, menestras entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio, Jesus se dedica a esta labor para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para compra mercadería para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Jesus María is 35 years old. She lives with her husband in the village of La Toma, a rural area in the district of Buenos Aires where the people work in agriculture, commerce and livestock. It belongs to the province of Piura and region of the same name and is located on the northern coast of Perú. 

She sells groceries such as rice, milk, sugar, beans and more. Her business is located at home. Jesus is engaged in this work in order to support her husband with the household expenses. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 Peruvian nuevos soles in order to buy merchandise to stock her business in order to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock her grocery store

loans.name: Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
Niño Jesus está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, por lo que cada una está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para conocer la situación en la que cada una esta.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Claudia quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando cada vez más su situación, pero igualmente está consciente de que este trabajo y esfuerzo que está haciendo debe ser continuo y permanente para lograr un éxito total, ya que con ello podrá dar un mejor bienestar a su familia. Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que es modista, también se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder superar la pobreza.
La Sra.  Claudia Solicita de este crédito para la compra de telas en general, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Niño Jesus group is in the “Poverty Stoplight” program and all of them are doing the survey to eliminate poverty in order to know the situation of each one.

One of the members is Claudia who through her struggles and unceasing work and application of the vital behavior of a successful woman, is improving her situation, and is aware that this work and struggle that she has been going through must be permanent and ongoing to achieve total success, so that she will be able to provide better wellbeing for her family.

Besides the work that she does as a dressmaker, also to be highlighted is the work of the advisors who continuously oversee the training and measure the progress while at the same time encouraging the women to fight to overcome poverty.

Claudia is asking for this loan in order to buy fabrics which will help her finalize her business plan which will help her improve her income.

loans.use: to buy several fabrics to be used in her sewing business

loans.name: Jiinue Biashara Group

texts.en:
This is a Nuru International group of four farmers called Jiinue and is based within Kuria West District. They come together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture.

Peter, holding up his hand, is 30 years old and has been a member of this group for more than four years. He is married with four children who go to school.

Peter is asking for a loan to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer, which is one way of implementing better farming methods that would lead to increased yields of sorghum, millet and maize during the harvest of 2014 Long Rains. 

The harvest will provide enough food for his family and he will sell the surplus. With the money from the surplus, he will invest in a business to increase his family’s income.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to increase the yields of sorghum, millet and maize

loans.name: Angela Del Socorro

texts.es: Angela tiene 33 años de edad, casada y madre de 3 hijos. Originaria de la ciudad de Teustepe, Boaco. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas. Desde muy niña comenzó a elaborar tortillas, ya que le ayudaba a su mama, debido a que  eran una familia de  pocos recursos económicos. Tiempo después decide tener su propio negocio. Desde hace varios años trabaja en la elaboración y venta de tortillas, permitiéndole salir adelante con sus hijos. Su meta próxima es incrementar su negocio. Solicita un crédito para comprar harina de maíz al por mayor y leña, con el fin de incrementar la producción de su producto. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que aumentara sus ventas y podrá obtener más ganancias.  Su plan futuro es extender su local.
texts.en:
Angela is 33 years old, married and the mother of 3 children. She is originally from the city of Teustepe, Boaco. 

She is a merchant who makes and sells tortillas. She has been making tortillas since she was a child, as she used to help her mother since they were a family with scarce financial resources. Later she decided to open her own business. She has been working making and selling tortillas for some years allowing her to raise her children. Her next goal is to increase her business. 

She is asking for a loan in order to buy cornmeal in bulk and firewood, in order to increase the production of her product. She thinks that the loan will be very helpful for increasing her sales and obtaining more income. Her future plan is to expand her facility.

loans.use: to buy cornmeal in bulk and firewood

loans.name: Awad

texts.en:
Awad is 52 years old and he lives with his wife and his seven children in Gaza. He has a small grocery and this is the only source of income for his family.

His house was damaged by the war, so he applied for this loan to repair his house, especially the windows, which will help them to take a step forward. His dream is to educate his children and give them the best for their lives.

He is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to repair his house, especially the windows, because it was damaged by the war

loans.name: Jamal

texts.en:
Jamal is 39 years old and he lives in Gaza with his wife.

For the past two years, he has run his own grocery store which helped him in gathering money and funds his marriage. He sells different kinds of foodstuffs like soft drinks and kids' stuff.  He hopes that this loan will allow him to buy a refrigerator and shelves. He plans to open a supermarket in the future. 

Jamal is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and shelves for his grocery

loans.name: Pa Bong 2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thanh is 29 years old. She has been doing several jobs such as raising poultry and cattle and working on the rice paddies. Thanh also has to take care of her family of 6 members. She has two kids: one is in kindergarten and one of them was just born 3 weeks ago. Regardless of her health condition, Thanh has to return to work on the field in order to feed her family. 

This is her 4th loan cycle with ACE and she wants to use her loan of 5,000000 VND to buy wood to rebuild her downgraded house as well as fertilizer for the next crop. It is Thanh's dream to be able to finance the education of all her children. She hopes all her children will finish college, attain good jobs and be financially independent. In the picture, Thanh is standing first from the right.

loans.use: to buy wood for rebuilding downgraded house and buy fertilizer for the next crop

loans.name: Moain

texts.en:
Moain is a 21-year-old single man who lives in Sana`a,Yemen. He has a grocery store where he sells various products. His objective is to improve his family’s standard of living, in order to offer them better alternatives for progress. He has spent five years working in business. He didn`t complete his studies, due to the bad situations he faced, and nobody tried to help him to continue his studying. 

Moain describes his biggest business challenge as the delay of payment from his customers. So, he is asking for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to buy more grocery products to offer more variety to his customers, in order to always cover the delay of payment from his customers and thereby generate more income for his family. He hopes to expand his business so that it can continue to grow even more.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products so as to offer more variety to his customers.

loans.name: Pa Bong 3 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phoi is a Kho-mu ethnic minority and the age of 24. She is living in a thatched cottage with her husband and their two children. One kid is in kindergarten and the other is in primary school. 

Phoi and her husband are working as farmers with many agriculture activities including cultivating rice, cereal, coffee, and breeding pigs and buffalo. Now she not only faces the difficulty of a lack of capital but also pig diseases. She wants to use the loan of 4,000,000 VND to buy more pigs, food and vaccines for pigs. Phoi dreams of her children completing their studies at school and for her to be successful in her business. 

Phoi is the team leader of Pa Bong 3 group, which consist of 12 Kho-mu ethnic members. In the picture, she is standing first from the right.

loans.use: to buy more pigs, food and vaccines for pigs

loans.name: Ta Let Group

texts.en:
Ms. Dan is a single Thai lady and is 28 years old. She has been working on the farm since she was 12. Ever since her parents passed away when she was 16, she had to take care of herself and her younger brother. She said that at first she faced a lot of difficulties due to a lack of education (she quit school after 5th grade) and lack of capital because her family was poor, yet she made it through life. With support from ACE for agricultural training, Dan gained more experience on raising cattle and farming. For this loan cycle, Dan wants to use her loan to buy more piglets to expand her farm. 

She hopes that she can have a sustainable income to let her younger brother, who is currently in the 11th grade, go to university. She's proudly said that he's a smart one and deserves to have a good life. Dan is the team leader of Sai Luong Group, which consists of 13 Thai ethnic members. In the photo, she wore a red sweater, first from the right.

loans.use: to buy more piglets

loans.name: Hayman

texts.en:
Hayman is a 21-year-old man. He lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is a happy man who treats everyone well because of his opportunities to get ahead. He is an employee getting a low salary.

Hayman is about to get married. He intends to buy construction supplies for his house, but he does not have enough money to buy what he needs. He applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) to buy construction supplies to complete building his house. He hopes to establish a retail shop in order to increase his income.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to complete building his house

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en:
Shadi is 29 years old and he lives in Gaza with his wife and one child who attends the primary school.

In the first of May 2009, Shadi opened his own barbershop. He recently hired an employee to help him because his costumers are continuously increasing as he is very well known now.

He asked Ryada for this youth loan to buy a barber chair, shaving machine, and to redecorate his shop. This will increase the number of clients and increase his income, which will help him to improve the financial conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy a barber chair, a shaving machine, and redecorate his shop

loans.name: Romoz

texts.en:
Romoz is 21 years old and she lives with her family in Gaza. She dreams to be a businesswoman and insure good living conditions for her future kids and to avoid asking for help from anyone. Romoz works in her office as a tutor to the students.

Romoz is working hard to improve her business.  She has one employee. She applied to Ryada for this youth loan because she needs to buy tools like blackboards, chalk, tables and chairs to expand her office.

Romoz is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success.

loans.use: to buy tools like blackboards, chalk, tables and chairs to expand her office

loans.name: Shawq

texts.en:
Shawq is 22 years old. She lives with her husband and her two children in Gaza.

She has a poultry farm and she earns a monthly income of 350 USD. She started her business in 2010. This business helped the family income, especially as they have kids and need to ensure their needs, because her husband works in a public institution and is familiar with low salaries. 

She needs this youth loan to repair the poultry yard and buy food for the birds. Her dream is to educate her children and give them the best in their life. Shawq is very grateful to everyone who helps her to achieve success in her business with this loan.

loans.use: to repair the poultry yard and buy food for the birds

loans.name: Charlie

texts.en:
Charlie is a 52-year-old farmer who is a hard working man. He has been doing his best in order to have good living conditions someday. With his determination to earn a better income, he doubles his hard work in cultivating his farm land to gain better crops.

Charlie has managed his farming business for 17 years. He knows that this kind of business is not an easy occupation, but despite his situation, his desire to achieve his dream inspires him to develop his business. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to develop the growth of his crops. He hopes that through these farm inputs he can grow plenty of crops for the betterment of their living situation.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides to use for farming business

loans.name: Verónica Andrea

texts.es:
Verónica, a sus 25 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar de manera independiente como estilista de belleza, conoció el oficio porque realizó cursos de capacitación y la experiencia laboral la obtuvo trabajando en una sala de belleza; pero luego de un tiempo tomó la decisión de independizarse y comenzó prestando sus servicios a domicilio y en algunas ocasiones sus clientes van a la casa donde reside; trabaja todos los días y ofrece los servicios de corte, cepillado, químicos, manicure, pedicure, peinados, entre otros; así ha logrado generar los recursos para apoyar a su esposo con la carga económica del hogar.
Ha sobrepasado diversos obstáculos, porque cuando inició como independiente, no poseía los implementos de trabajo y debía esperar a que se los prestaran para realizar los domicilios; sin embargo, con empuje y mucho esfuerzo logró adquirirlos.
Actualmente solicita el apoyo del crédito con el ánimo de fortalecer su negocio, con el dinero comprará insumos al por mayor (químicos, accesorios de decoración de uñas y peinados, shampoo, acondicionador, entre otros) y activos (cepillos y plancha de cerámica); esto le permitirá tener disponibilidad de productos para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y además podrá agilizar en tiempo con sus propias herramientas de trabajo; así mejorará las ventas y los ingresos que percibe.
Verónica sueña con tener su propia sala de belleza ubicada en un local comercial abierto al público, para mejorar su rentabilidad y garantizar una estabilidad económica para disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Veronica is 25 years old and works on her own as a beauty stylist.  She learned this work because she took a training course and she got her work experience working in a beauty shop but after some time she decided to go out on her own and began offering her services in people’s homes and at times her customers go to her home.  She works every day and does cuts, combings, chemical treatments, manicures, pedicures, hairstyles, and other things.  She has managed to generate the resources she needs to help her husband with the household finances.

She has overcome several obstacles because when she started her business, she didn’t have any work tools and she had to wait to borrow them to work.  However she was able to acquire them through her drive and lots of effort.

She is asking for this loan to buy supplies in quantity (chemicals, nail and hair decorations, shampoo, conditioner, and other things) and assets (brushes and a ceramic iron).  This will allow her to have these items available to satisfy her customers’ needs and speed things up by having her own tools.  She will be able to increase her sales and income.

Veronica dreams of having her own salon located in a shopping center so she can increase her profits and guarantee stable finances, a better quality of life and wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy tools and supplies.

loans.name: Cristo Salvador Group

texts.es: Cecilia una de las fundadoras del grupo “Cristo Salvador” conformada por 07 socios responsables y solidarios que con el fruto de sus esfuerzos han ido mejorando. Cecilia de 55 años es  casada con 02 hijos independientes. Ella  se dedica al pelado de ajíes para luego ser distribuidos en mercados y tiendas, lleva en esta actividad más de 08 años. Cecilia se siente feliz pues gracias a su esfuerzo puede seguir apoyando a su pareja con los gastos. El crédito que solicitó lo destinará para la compra de ajíes. El deseo de Cecilia es de independizarse, pues actualmente trabaja con un familiar. El grupo “Cristo Salvador” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Cecilia se encuentra de pie, es la primera del lado derecho, viste polo blanco y chaleco negro.
texts.en: Cecilia is one of the founders of the “Cristo Salvador” group, made up of seven responsible and united women who have been improving through their efforts.  Cecilia is 55 years old, married and has two adult children.  She peels peppers for later selling in stores and markets.  She has been doing this for more than 8 years and she is happy because she can continue helping her husband with the household expenses.  She is asking for this loan to buy peppers.  Cecilia works with her family.  The “Cristo Salvador” group is grateful to those who made this loan possible.  Cecilia is standing on the right, wearing a white polo shirt and black vest.

loans.use: to buy peppers.

loans.name: Señor Del Rimac Group

texts.es: Los socios del grupo “SEÑOR DEL RIMAC” se siente muy satisfechos por estar pasando el 03 ciclo. Cristina tiene 32 años es casada con 03 hijos  dependientes. Ella se dedica al cultivo y venta de flores en el cual cuenta con el apoyo de sus 03 hijos. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de semillas y fertilizantes para mejorar sus cultivos. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Cristina es la tercera del lado derecho viste polo fucsia.
texts.en: The members of the “SEÑOR DEL RIMAC” group are very satisfied to be in their 3rd cycle. Cristina is 32 years old. She is married and has three dependent children. She grows and sells flowers and has the help of her three children. She will invest the loan in buying seeds and fertilizer to improve her crops. The group is grateful to the Kiva investors for the loan. Cristina is third from the right and wearing a fuchsia t-shirt.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Leticia Verónica

texts.es:
Leticia es una pequeña comerciante, se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de ropa, cosméticos y calzados. 

Leticia es casada, tiene tres hijos, el más pequeño tiene un año de edad. Su esposo es transportista, ambos velan por el bienestar y educación de sus hijos.  Leticia solicita el crédito para continuar invirtiendo a su negocio, comprará ropa para niños, cosméticos, perfumes y calzados, y así aumentar la demanda de productos que ofrece a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Leticia is a small merchant who has been selling clothing, cosmetics, and shoes for several years.

Leticia is married, has three children and the youngest is a year old.  Her husband is a driver and both work for their children’s wellbeing and to provide them with an education.  Leticia is asking for a loan to continue her business.  She will buy children’s clothing, cosmetics, perfumes, and shoes so she can increase her inventory.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Los Geranios Group

texts.es: Los socios del grupo “LOS GERANIOS” se encuentran pasando el 03 ciclo. Cynthia tiene 26 es soltera con hijo dependiente. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos cosméticos colonias y a la venta de zapatos carteras a pedidos. El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de zapatos y carteras por campaña para expenderlos un precio  que le genere mejores ingresos económicos. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Cynthia es la primera del lado derecho. De la misma manera se encuentra adjuntada la foto de Crecencia que no pudo estar presente en la reunión por motivos laborales.
texts.en: The “LOS GERANIOS” are in their third cycle.  Cynthia is 26 years old, single, and has one son who depends on her.  She sells beauty products, colognes, and shoes to order. She will use the money from this loan to buy shoes and wallets to sell and generate income.  The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for this loan.  Cynthia is the first to the right.  Crecencia’s photo is attached because she was not able to attend the meeting because of work.

loans.use: to buy shoes and wallets.

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es: María de 45 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su esposo desde hace mucho tiempo. Sus hijos son mayores de edad y viven aparte y cuando pueden le colaboran con la economía del hogar. María se dedica a la venta de lácteos(queso, crema y Leche.) y helados desde hace 4 años. EL negocio lo tiene en su hogar de residencia y es así como logra sacar los ingresos para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Junto a su esposo trabajan duramente para ganarse el pan de cada día. Desea mejorar el piso de su vivienda ya que actualmente es de tierra y desea pavimentar el corredor para tener mayor higiene. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y grava para dar inicio a la mejora del piso.
texts.en: María is 45 years old. She has lived in her own home with her husband for a long time. Her children are adults and live on their own. When they can they contribute to the household budget. María has sold dairy products (cheese, cream and milk) and ice cream for 4 years. She has the business in her home and that is how she is able to get income to support the household. With her husband, she works hard to earn the daily bread. She wants to improve the floor in the house because it is a dirt floor now. She wants to pave the hallway to have more cleanliness. She is asking for this loan from FUSAI to invest in buying cement, sand and gravel to begin improving the floor.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and gravel.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: Carlos es originario de la ciudad de Granada. Se dedica al servicio de coche turístico, el cual le ha permitido salir adelante en la vida. Esta agradecido con Kiva y MiCredito ya que ha podido darle mantenimiento a su coche para mejorar la atracción y el servicio a su clientela. Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar pintura, con el fin de darle un acabado a sus cuatros coches. Estima que el crédito le ayudara a incrementar su clientela ya que tendrá una mejor presentación e incrementara sus ganancias.
texts.en: Carlos is from the city of Granada. He works in a tourism car service. This has allowed him to get ahead in life. He is grateful to the Kiva and MiCredito because he has been able to do maintenance on his car to improve the attraction and service for customers. He is asking for a new loan to buy paint in order to out a finish on his four cars. He thinks the loan will help him to increase his customers since he will have better appearance and will increase his earnings.

loans.use: to buy paint.

loans.name: Na Sang 2 Group

texts.en:
Tam is a single mom of Lao minority. She divorced from her husband 3 years ago and brought up her child on her own since the child was 2 years old. To earn a living, Tam works hard with plenty of agricultural activities such as cultivating rice, vegetables and cereal, breeding chickens, pigs and buffalo. 

This is her first loan in Anh Chi Em Program and Tam hopes this loan can help her resolve partially the difficulty of lacking capital. She would use the loan to rent a machine for leveling the field in order to prepare for the next harvest. 

Tam dreams her child will eventually attend college as she was only able to complete secondary school because financial issues made it impossible for her to continue. In the picture, Tam is standing first from the right.

loans.use: to rent a machine to level the field preparing for the next harvest

loans.name: Las Aguilas Group

texts.es:
Las Aguilas  está en su primer ciclo  del programa de comité, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde cinco de las dieciocho señoras se encuentran por debajo de la línea de pobreza, es decir con ingresos bajos, pero están luchando por mejorar sus vidas.
Rogelia es vendedora de ropas, es una persona muy sacrificada, que con mucho esfuerzo pudo empezar a trabajar, y por medio de este trabajo ayuda a su familia. Su sueño es poder tener una tienda donde pueda vender sus prendas y seguir ayudando a su familia. Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en comprar ropas variadas, para que por medio de eso pueda seguir con sus ventas y luchando por mejorar su situación de pobreza.
texts.en:
Las Águilas, [The Eagles] are in their first cycle of the communal bank program, in which they have all committed themselves to working and helping each other to move forward.  They are completing the elimination of poverty survey, where five of the eighteen ladies find themselves below the poverty line, with low income, but they are fighting to improve their lives. 

Rogelia, who sells clothing, is a very selfless person.  With great effort she was able to begin working, and through her work she helps her family.  Her dream is to be able to have a shop where she could sell her clothing and continue helping her family.
 
She is requesting this loan so that she can invest it in purchasing an assortment of clothing.  In this way, she can continue with her sales and continue striving to move out of poverty.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.es:
Lucrecia tiene 51 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Oyotun, una comunidad que se caracteriza por ser acogedora, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad, su bodega se encuentra ubicada en su domicilio, cuenta con clientela considerable, Lucrecia es una mujer que se esfuerza en la labor que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mercadería para abastecer su negocio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en: Lucrecia is 51 years old.  She lives in the Oyotun district, located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque region on Peru’s north coast.  The community is known for its hospitality and its people are engaged in agriculture, business, and cattle raising.  Lucrecia is engaged in selling basic necessities.  Her grocery store is located in her home, and she has a considerable number of customers.  She is a woman who makes an effort in her work.  She is requesting a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to purchase merchandise to stock her business and, in this way, generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to stock her business.

loans.name: Maria Elvira

texts.es: María de 58 años de edad habita en casa propia junto a su hija y su nieta de 12 años de edad. María es una mujer trabajadora quien con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado comprar tres vacas las cuales son su principal fuente de ingresos ya que todos los días se levanta muy temprano para extraer la leche que luego convierte en delicioso queso, crema y requeson. Así es como ha logrado mantener la economía del hogar y llevar el sustento a su familia. Actualmente no cuneta con agua potable y energía eléctrica por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la instalación del servicio de agua potable y de la energía eléctrica. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida  y las de su familia.
texts.en:
María is 58 years old and lives in her own home with her daughter and her granddaughter who is 12 years old.

María is a hardworking woman who through a lot of effort has managed to buy 3 cows which are her main source of income. Every day she gets up very early to milk the cows and later she makes it into a delicious cheese, cottage cheese, and makes other products from cream. This is how she has managed to maintain the household expenses and provide for the family.

Currently she does not have drinking water or electricity so she has made the decision to ask for a loan from FUSAI in order to invest in the installation of drinking water and electricity. She hopes to receive this loan so she can improve her living conditions and those of her family.

loans.use: to pay for the installation of drinking water and electricity in her home

loans.name: Ry

texts.en:
Ry is 52 years old and lives with his family in Prey Veng province. As other local people, Ry works in agriculture, growing rice both for sustenance and sale. He has learned to do this from his parents and older people and has been in this career for more than 30 years. His wife and children are the main force/labor in helping him with the farming works.

He is requesting a loan of 700 US dollars to build a safe latrine as he doesn’t have it yet at home. In this way, he can improve sanitation and general living conditions. The water loan program, offered by HKL with a special rate, has helped to encourage Ry to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of his family and protect the environment. He expresses his thanks to all kind lenders around the world.

loans.use: to build a safe latrine at home.

loans.name: Na Sang 1 Group

texts.en:
Ly is a 34-year-old woman of Lao minority. She is living with her father, younger brother, who is 20 years old, and her child, who is 6 years old. When her child was born, she divorced her husband because he was using opium drug. Despite financial difficulties, she sends her child to school. 

Ly and her father and her brother are working as farmers. They're planting rice, cereal, vegetables and coffee, and raising pigs and some other cattle. This is the 4th cycle of loans and she will use the money to rent a machine to level the field they are preparing for the next crop. She says that it's hard to obtain capital to do her business so she's thankful to ACE and Kiva's lenders who help her deal with this problem. 

She hopes that her child will complete junior high school and be successful in the future so that her family's life will be improved. In the picture, Ly is standing first from the right.

loans.use: to rent a machine to level the field.

loans.name: Chet

texts.en:
Chet is 52 and an experienced farmer from a remote area of Kampong Cham province. She is married with six children, two of whom are employed in the garment sector in Phnom Penh. To meet the needs of her family, Chet has been engaged in the rice-farming business for many years and earns a decent income. Her husband is very supportive and always helps her manage their farm. 

With the purpose of aiming to improve general living conditions, Chet is asking for a loan of USD 1,000 to build a safe latrine at home. The water loan program, offered by HKL with a special rate, has helped to encourage Chet to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and protect the environment. She is very grateful to all kind lenders in advance.

loans.use: to build a safe latrine at home.

loans.name: Martha Amalia

texts.es: Doña Martha, es casada, tiene 3 hijos, solamente uno es dependiente de ellos, ya que tiene capacidades diferente, y necesitan brindarle la atención y ayuda que necesita. Ella empezó hace algunos años vendiendo refrescos en su casa de habitación, a través de créditos ha ido mejorando poco a poco su negocio, hasta tener ahora una pulpería. El crédito lo usará para seguir invirtiendo en el negocio, comprará granos básicos y productos perecederos, y así poder aumentar su capital de trabajo para seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
Martha is married with three children. Only one of them is dependent on her being born with special needs and they provide the needed care and support.

A few years ago she began selling beverages from her home, and through loans has been improving her business little by little, and now she has a small store.

She will use the loan to continue investing in her business, buying basic grains and perishable goods so that she can increase her working capital and continue growing.

loans.use: to buy basic grains and perishable goods for her store

loans.name: Sreyon

texts.en:
Sreyon, aged 32, is a resident from Preah Sdach district in Prey Veng province. She is married, but she and her husband live separately due to unavoidable circumstances. She has a daughter who is in school. To cover the daily cost of living, Sreyon relies on the income from her rice-farming business and retailing store. She has been doing this for nearly five years.

As this will be her first loan, Sreyon will initially invest in the purchase of a solar home system in order to gain access to electricity. In this way, she can provide light for her children to study at night and use other home devices such as TV, radio etc. With the loan support, she hopes to improve her general living conditions and make their lives more comfortable. She thanks lenders for their financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to purchase a solar home system.

loans.name: Nhanh

texts.en:
Nhanh is 39 years old, and lives with her husband and some children in Chrang Khpos village, a rural zone in the Rokhak Kiri disctrict, which is located in Battambang province. Two of her children are employed as paid laborers in Cambodia’s neighboring country, Thailand, where they expect to earn a higher income than what they do locally. They send a small remittance home to their parents each month in order to help their younger brother and sister in their education. However, Nhanh doesn’t rely on her children’s remittance. She, together with her husband, works in agriculture, growing rice on their own land, which was inherited by their both parents. She has about 10 years experience in this field. 

As of now, she is requesting a loan to build a safe latrine at home. In this way she hopes to increase the value of her home, and improve sanitation. The water loan program offered by HKL with a special interest rate has helped to encourage Nhanh to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a safe latrine at home.

loans.name: Vut

texts.en:
Vut, a 36-year-old married man, currently lives with his wife and three dependent children in a remote area of the Siem Reap province. Two of his children are attending the local primary school. Vut’s family relies on the income from a farming and  a recycling business. Together, Vut and his wife, are able to earn approximately KHR 30,000 per day.

With this loan amount, Vut will buy a used motorcycle to meet the transportation needs of the household and enable him in his recycling business. Vut hopes that with more savings and stability in his income, he can improve his family's living standard and provide them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a used motorcycle to meet the transportation needs of the household and enable him in his recycling business.

loans.name: Las Manitos De Jesús Group

texts.es: Inocencia de 49 años de edad, es viuda y tiene 1 hijo del cual aún depende de ella. Lleva 1 año como cliente de Edaprospo y se dedica a la venta de productos de variedad ya que cuenta con una Bodega. Comenzó por medio de la necesidad de tener ingresos ya que su esposo había fallecido por eso que puso su propio negocio como una persona independiente. También se dedica la venta de comida. Con su esfuerzo y trabajo, Inocencia ha logrado construir su casa y a darles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Ella cubre los gastos de alimentación, educación, vestimenta y servicios su hogar. Su plan para el futuro es que crezca su negocio, terminar de construir el segundo piso de su casa y que su hijo estudie en la universidad. Ella usa el préstamo para la compra de abarrotes en general. Inocencia pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Las Manitos de Jesús”, el cual está conformado por 6 personas y lleva el cargo de presidenta.
texts.en:
Inocencia is 49 years old, a widow with one child who is dependent on her. She has been a client of Edaprospo for one year. She sells a variety of products as she has a store. She started because of the need to have some income as her husband died. So she opened her store as an independent person. She also sells meals.

With her effort and work she has managed to build a house and offer a higher quality of living to her family. She covers the cost of education, food, clothing and services for the household. Her future plan is to expand her business, complete the construction of the second floor of her house and send her son to study at university.

Inocencia will use the loan to buy groceries. She belongs to the “Las Manitos de Jesús” communal bank, which is composed of six members. Inocencia is the president.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Marta Lorena

texts.es: Doña Marta es una humilde señora de 51 años de edad, originaria de la ciudad de Granada. Madre soltera de un hijo ya independiente. Es de oficio costurera, se dedica a la confección de ropa. Inicio este negocio hace varios años, el cual aprendió observando a su hermana realizando vestidos; luego, poco a poco, fue aprendiendo todo en el ramo de la costura. Actualmente mantiene su negocio de costura muy productivo. Su meta próxima es expandirse en el mercado para dar a conocer su trabajo de costura. Solicita un crédito para comprar telas al por mayor, cipers, botones, accesorios para los vestidos, hijos entre otros, con el fin de realizar mas la elaboración de ropa. Estima que el crédito le ayudara ya que podrá incrementar la producción de ropa e incrementando los pedidos de sus clientes. Su plan futuro es tener un taller grande donde pueda ofrecerle más mercadería a su clientela.
texts.en:
Marta is a modest 51 year old woman who is a native of Granada. She is the single mother of a child who is now independent. She is a seamstress who makes clothing. She started this business a number of years ago. She learned by watching her sister making dresses. Then little by little she learned all there is to know to make clothes.

She is quite productive in her business. Her next goal is to expand in the market and make her work well-known. Marta is requesting a loan to buy cloth wholesale, plus zippers, buttons, clothing accessories, thread etc. in order to make clothes. She estimates that the loan will help her increase her production and increase the orders from her customers. Her future plan is to have a large workshop where she can offer more merchandise to her clients.

loans.use: to buy cloth wholesale, buttons. zippers and accessories for clothing.

loans.name: Hom

texts.en:
Hom is 56 years old and a married woman with four children. She runs a small business farming and selling rice in her region of Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham. She has been doing this for over 30 years and has the support from her husband and children.

As of now, she is seeking a loan which enables her to build a household latrine. In this way, she can improve sanitation and general living conditions. The water loan program, offered by HKL with a special rate, has helped to encourage Hom to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and protect the environment. She is very thankful to all lenders for their generous funds.

loans.use: to build a household latrine.

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en:
This is a 51-year-old woman and a resident from a peaceful village of Santuk district, Kampong Thom province. Her name is Thoeun. She's married with three grown-up children, two of whom who are studying at universities. Thoeun and her husband are working as farmers with a lot of agricultural activities, including growing rice, cassavas, and breeding poultry. She has been in this field for almost 30 years.

She is now asking for a loan, which enables her to build a household latrine to improve their general living conditions. The water loan program, offered by HKL with a special interest rate, has helped to encourage Thoeun to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions to safeguard the health of her family and protect the environment. She is very thankful to all lenders for their generous funds.

loans.use: to build a household latrine to improve their general living conditions.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es: Luis de 31 años de edad es soltero y habita junto a su madre y dos sobrinos y una hermana quienes dependen económicamente de él. Luis presta servicios de seguridad en una hacienda cercana a su localidad. Con los ingresos que percibe de su trabajo logra llevar el sustento a su hogar y mantiene la economía familiar. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y grava para repellar las paredes de la vivienda y encementar el piso ya que en la actualidad es de tierra y desea mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is 31 years old. He lives with his mother, two nephews, and a sister who all depend on him economically. Luis works in security at an estate close to his home. With the money he makes at his work, he manages to pay the household expenses and maintain the family economy.

Luis is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in purchasing cement, sand and gravel to plaster the walls of his house and to cement in the floors which presently are packed dirt. He wants to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel to plaster the walls of his house and cement in the floors.

loans.name: Yolanda Celinda

texts.es:
Yolanda Celinda tiene 44 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos en el Distrito de Santo Tomas, una comunidad acogedora, que se caracteriza por sus bosques verdes y relieve accidentado que le ha permitido tener diversos pisos ecológicos para desarrollarse mediante la agricultura,, su población también se dedica al comercio y ganadería.

Ella brinda servicio de molienda de todo tipo de granos maíz blanco, maíz amarillo, todo tipo de menestras, café entre otros, sus clientes son en gran parte comerciantes del Distrito de Santo Tomas y sus Caseríos que se dedican a vender estos granos en sus puestos de venta, esta actividad la realiza hace más de 6 años, cuenta con un basta experiencia en el rubro.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de un motor para su equipo de molino con lo que tendrá mayor potencia y mayor capacidad para brindar el servicio de molienda y así poder atender a más clientes, generándole mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Yolanda Celinda is 44 years old.  She lives with her children in the Santo Tomas district, a welcoming community known for its green forests and rugged terrain that have provided the area with diverse ecological zones for agricultural development.  The people are also engaged in business and cattle raising.

Yolanda provides milling services for all types of grains, including white corn, yellow corn, all types of legumes, coffee, and others.  The majority of her customers are business owners from the Santo Tomas district and its villages that sell these grains in their stalls.  She has been engaged in this activity for over six years, and has extensive experience in the trade.

Yolanda is requesting a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles to purchase a motor for her mill equipment, with which she will have more power and, in this way, be able to serve more customers, and generate more income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motor to upgrade her mill.

loans.name: Emprendedoras Del Valle El Triunfo Group

texts.es: La Sra. Lucia   de 50  años de edad casada  y madre de  5 hijos, la Sra. Lucia  tiene una pequeña bodega  ya hace unos  7  años. La Sra. Lucia,  ha llegado a fidelizar  a sus clientes   el cual le ha generado ganancias para poder cubrir los gastos de su hogar,  En el futuro le gustaría tener un local propio donde poder vender sus productos y obtener mayores ganancias económicas. Con el préstamo otorgado lo invertirá en comprar más productos (arroz, menestras, etc.) Para su bodega  y así seguir satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes y así poder salir adelante. A la vez  la Sra. Lucia   y todos los integrantes se encuentran  agradecidos   con Kiva  por el préstamo otorgado   y por la confianza que se  les ha sido brindada. La Sra. Lucia  se le distingue por su camisa de color rojo,   Se despide  Dejando la promesa  que cumplirá todas sus metas propuestas.
texts.en:
Lucia is 50 years old, she is married, and she is the mother of 5 children.  Lucia has had a small store for 7 years.  She has loyal customers and this has generated enough income to cover her household expenses.  In the future she would like to own a local grocery store where she can sell her products and make a better living.

With this loan she will buy more products (rice, beans, etc.) for her store, which will enable her to continue to meet the needs of her customers so that she will be able to get by.

Lucia and all of the members of the group are thankful to Kiva for the loan and for the confidence that they have shown by supporting them. Lucia is the woman in the photo with the red top.  She promises to comply punctually with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy products for their store.

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras Group

texts.es: “MUJERES EXITOSAS” es un grupo compuesto por socios ansiosos de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Cicely tiene 35 años es conviviente con 02 hijos dependientes. Ella es técnica en farmacia trabaja 11 años en un centro de salud. Atrás se dedicaba a ser estudiante. El préstamo lo invertirá en el pago de cursos de especialización y actualización de su carrera profesional. Su mayor es tener una casa propia. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Cicely es la segunda persona parada del lado derecho viste polo blanco.
texts.en:
“MUJERES EXITOSAS” is a group comprised of members that are eager to improve the quality of life for their families.  Cicely is 35 years old and lives with her two dependent children. She is a pharmacist and has worked for 11 years in a health center.  Before doing this work she was a student.

This loan will be invested in the payment of specialization and refresher courses for her professional career.  Her biggest dream is to have her own home.

The group is thankful to the Kiva lenders for the loan they have provided.  Cicely is the second person standing on the right-hand side in the white shirt.

loans.use: to pay for specialized and refresher courses.

loans.name: Santa Lucrecia Group

texts.es:
Don Tomás es un señor de 56 años de edad, solo estudio la secundaria y es soltero. Él es otro de los integrantes del grupo Santa Lucrecia, cuenta que como no tuvo la oportunidad de tener más estudios inició a trabajar desde muy joven y tuvo distintos empleos, pero fue hace 19 años que lo invitaron a ser vocero de “La Crónica” (periódico que informa las noticias en Tierra Blanca) y le platicaron que las ganancias que le dejaba eran buenas así que decidió entrar y desde entonces se dedica a la venta del periódico.
Don Tomás es una persona emprendedora que durante muchos años se ha dedicado a esta actividad, él sale todos los días desde muy temprano a comprar el periódico e inicia a venderlo por las calles, sus ventas son buenas ya que tiene buenos clientes. Él dice que termina más rápido de vender cuando las noticias son buenas. 
Lo que más le gusta de su negocio es que está en contacto con la gente y que gana su dinero a diario informando a la gente de los acontecimientos que ocurren en su región.
Un crédito de Kiva y VisionFund le ayudará a invertir en la compra de periódicos para continuar con sus ventas.

Él espera que con esta inversión su negocio prospere y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
Los demás integrantes del grupo son:

Maribel venta de comida
Roxana venta de cosméticos
Alicia venta de quesos, totopos y tlayudas
Teresa venta de topperware
Julia venta de perfumes 
Leticia venta de ropa, manteles y cortinas
Liliana venta de cosméticos 
Maria Eugenia venta  de refrescos 
Leticia M venta de tacos
Verónica venta de cosméticos 
Verónica F compra de variedad de zapatos
texts.en:
Don Tomás is a 56 year old man who is single and only studied until secondary school. He is one of the members of the Santa Lucrecia Communal Bank. He notes that as he did not have the opportunity to get more education, he started working when he was very young and had a number of different jobs. Nineteen years ago he was invited to be a spokesperson for “La Crónica” (a newspaper that publishess the news in Tierra Blanca) and they told him that the profits were good and so he decided to take the job and since then he has made a living selling the newspaper.

Don Tomás is a very enterprising person who for many years has run this business. He departs very early every day to purchase the newspapers and then starts to sell them on the street. His sales are good because he has good customers. He says that he finishes his sales more quickly when the news is good.

What he most enjoys about his business is that he is in contact with people and that he earns his money every day informing people of the events that are happening in their region.  A loan from Kiva and VisionFund will help him to purchase newspapers to continue with his sales.

He hopes that with this investment his business will prosper and that he will improve his quality of life.  The other members of the group are:

Maribel – who sells meals
Roxana – who sells cosmetics
Alicia – who sells cheese, “totopos” and “tlayudas”
Teresa – who sells Tupperware
Julia – who sells perfume
Leticia – who sells clothing, blankets and curtains
Liliana - who sells cosmetics
Maria Eurgenia – who sells soft drinks
Leticia M. – who sells tacos
Verónica - who sells cosmetics.
Verónica F – who sells different kinds of shoes.

loans.use: to purchase newspapers.

loans.name: Digna

texts.es:
Digna tiene 42 años de edad, vive junto a sus hijos en el Caserío de San José, una zona rural del distrito de Pucará, es una comunidad que se caracteriza por su clima caluroso, su población se dedica al cultivo de arroz, siendo este el de mayor producción, así como al comercio en general y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la cría y comercio de animales, caprinos , porcinos, aves y ganado vacuno, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace más de 10 años, es una madre emprendedora que se esfuerza en la labor que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de más animales para su comercialización y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Digna, 42, and her children live in San Jose, a rural town in Peru's Cajamarca region. The tropical climate here supports rice farming, a common source of income for local people. Other sources of income include small retail businesses and animal-rearing.

Digna raises and sells pigs, poultry, cattle and other farm animals. She has made her living buying and selling animals for more than 10 years. She is an enterprising woman and has worked hard to make a success of the business. She is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a 1,000-new soles loan that she will use to buy animals that she will fatten and sell. The investment will increase her income and help her to better support her family.

loans.use: to buy animals for animals sales business.

loans.name: Guipiles De Tzani Group

texts.es:
La señora Paulina de estado civil casada. De 45 años de edad. No tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar. Tiene 8 hijos y de ellos 3 estan estudiando. Se dedica a la elaboración de Gupliles de la región. Inició este negocio por la enseñanza de su madre y a la fecha lleva 10 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará para la compra de hilos para elaborar guipiles bordados. Desea en el futuro contar con un capital grande y propio para poder producir por mayor y ofrecer variedad de estilos en sus ventas.

Las demás integrantes del grupo de dedican al comercio y artesanía.
texts.en:
Paulina is married, she is 45 years old, and she never had the opportunity to attend school.  She has 8 children and 3 of them are in school.  She makes Gupliles from the local region (traditional embroidered blouses worn by women).  She started this business after she was taught the trade from her mother and now she has 10 years of experience doing this work.

She is seeking a loan so that she can buy thread in order to create the embroidered blouses. She dreams of a future in which she has capital so that she can produce bulk items and offer a variety of styles for sale.

The women members of this group all work in commerce and crafts.

loans.use: to buy thread.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 61 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Pomahuaca, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de cacao en los caseríos de Lamparan, también se dedica a la cría y venta de ganado caprino y vacuno, es una familia unida, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de abono para su cultivo y de esta manera tener una buena producción para ofrecer a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Victor, 61, lives with his wife and children in Pomahuaca, a rural district in Peru's Cajamarca region. The local economy is built around farming, animal-rearing and small retail businesses.

Victor grows cacao in the small rural town of Lamparan. He also raises and sells cattle and other farm animals. His family is solidly behind him and helps him with the business. Victor is applying for a 1,500-new soles loan that he will use to buy organic fertilizer for his next planting. The investment will help him to increase his production and, in turn, his family's income.

loans.use: to buy supplies for planting his next cacao crop.

loans.name: Leoncio Amado

texts.es:
Leoncio Amado tiene 67 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Pucará, es una comunidad que se caracteriza por su clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, cultivando frutas, arroz, cafe, entre otros, comercio de los mismos y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Jaén, que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, cultiva cafeto, tiene una experiencia de 18 años, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa, para utilizarlo en labores agrícolas, aplicaciones e incorporaciones de productos fito sanitarios, fertilizantes, y mano de obra para su cosecha y de esta manera tener una cosecha oportuna y por ende tendrá mayor producción, una mejor calidad de producto, por lo cual no tendrá problemas en vender su producto.
texts.en:
Leoncio Amado, 67, lives with his wife and kids in the district of Pucará, located in Jaén province in the Cajamarca region of the Peruvian northern sierra.  This community is characterized by a hot climate.  Its people work in agriculture, growing fruit, rice, coffee, etc., and also sell agricultural products and raise cattle. 

Leoncio Amado works in agriculture, growing coffee, and has 18 years of experience.  He has requested a loan of 1,500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa to use for agricultural work, application and incorporation of phytosanitary products, fertilizer, and labor for the harvest.  This will allow him to have a good harvest and ultimately a greater output and a higher quality product so he will have no trouble selling his product.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other inputs to maintain his coffee fields

loans.name: Wendy Auxiliadora

texts.es: Wendy es originaria de la ciudad de Granada, casada y sin hijos a cargo. Es de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de golosina y gaseosas en su casa. Inicio este negocio hace pocos años, vendiendo frijoles cocidos y queso en casa, poco a poco iba creciendo con sus ganancias. Luego, fue comprando golosinas y gaseosas para seguir creciendo con sus ingresos. Actualmente cuenta con un negocio bien próspero y rentable. Su meta próxima es mantener un negocio surtido de productos. Solicita un crédito para comprar gaseosas y golosinas al por mayor, con el fin de incrementar sus productos. Estima que el crédito le ayudara a obtener mejores ganancias ya que invertirá en el negocio e incrementando sus ventas. Su plan futuro es mantenerse en el negocio.
texts.en: Wendy lives in the Nicaraguan city of Granada.  She is married and has young children.  She operates a retail business, selling soft drinks and snacks, from a space in her house.  She started the business a few years ago, first selling cooked beans and cheese.  She increased her income bit by bit and then switched to soft drinks and snacks in order to increase her income even further.  The business is doing well now, she says, and is profitable.  Her immediate goal is to stock the business with more of the products she sells.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy bulk supplies of soft drinks and snacks.  She says the loan will increase her earnings because she will invest the funds in growing her business.

loans.use: to stock her retail business.

loans.name: Solidario En Victoria De San Lorenzo Group

texts.es: Solidario en victoria de San Lorenzo doña Virginia de 37 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos (8, 10, 15, 20 años) la familia se dedica a la elaboración de pan y poseen una panaderia  donde  vende sus productos  (francés, pan dulces, magdalenas, pay,  empanadas, donas etc.) en la aldea de San Lorenzo y como actividad secundaria vende refacciones en su local los sábados y domingos  (hamburguesas, tortillas con queso,  café, jugos, etc.)  Ella solicita su crédito para comprar un congelador  para guardar  sus productos ya que ella  quiere vender licuados y gaseosas frías ya que tiene una gran demanda de sus  clientes y la buscan en su negocio  porque es la única que vende refacciones y comida, su meta es poder tener otro local donde vender sus productos  ya con esto ella puede ayudar a su familia y darles un mejor futuro y darles  una mejor vida de la que ella pudo tener.
texts.en:
Solidario en Victoria de San Lorenzo Group

Virginia, 37, has four children (ages 8, 10, 15, and 20).  The family earns a living making bread.  They have a bakery in the town of San Lorenzo where they sell their products (baguettes, pan dulce, cupcakes, pie, empanadas, doughnuts, etc.).  As a secondary activity, on Saturday and Sunday she also sells snacks there (hamburgers, tortillas with cheese, coffee, juice, etc.).

Virginia's requesting a loan to buy a refrigerator for her products.  She wants to sell shakes and cold soda because there's a lot of customer demand for them in her bakery, which is the only one that sells snacks and food.

Her goal is to be able to have another place to sell her products.  This way she'll be able to help her family and give them a better future and a better life than the one she had.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es: Domingo de 53 años de edad habita en condiciones muy humildes junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad y le colaboran con los gastos del hogar. Domingo trabaja como agricultor. Todos los años siembre maíz y yuca en su terreno luego de la cosecha comercializa una parte y el resto lo deja para el consumo. Solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de su vivienda ya que actualmente se encuentra deteriorado. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, madera y pilines.
texts.en: Domingo, 53, and his wife live very modestly.  They share a small house with their three grown children and they all work together to pay household expenses.  Domingo is a farmer.  He has grown maize and yucca on his land for many years.  He sells part of his crop and keeps the rest for his own and his family's use.  He is applying for a FUSAI loan that he will use to repair his roof.  The roof is badly in need of repair and Domingo will use the loan to buy the building supplies he needs for the job.

loans.use: to buy building materials for roof repair.

loans.name: Nora Elizabeth

texts.es: Gracias a su primer financiamiento con los fondos de KIVA doña Nora compro los fertilizantes que necesitaba para poder asistir sus cultivos de café por lo que se encuentra muy feliz, muy satisfecha y muy contenta. Ella dio asistencia y mantenimiento a 4 manzanas de café con 15 quintales de abono con lo cual tuvo un pequeño corte el cual dio beneficios y cancelar su primer financiamiento para nuevamente poder acercarse con la frente en alto para poder solicitar un segundo financiamiento con el cual nuevamente comprara abono para dar asistencia y mantenimiento a otra parte de cultivo que recién planto. Después de su primer financiamiento su vida mejoro ya que en un principio no tenía una forma para poder comprar los insumos que necesitaba y gracias a la confianza que la cooperativa depósito en ella al explicarle sobre los nuevos fondos ella accedió con mucha facilidad por la tasa de interés, el monto y el plazo para poder cancelar su compromiso. Sus metas son poder seguir trabajando en sus cultivos de café hasta donde Dios le permita, ampliar sus cultivos y solidificar sus cultivos para heredarlos a sus hijos.
texts.en: Thanks to a past loan from KIVA lenders, doña Nora bought the fertilizers that she needed to cultivate a coffee crop.  The investment was a success, she says.  She bought organic fertilizers to prepare 4 parcels of land for growing coffee and made a small profit.  She repaid that first loan and feels she can hold her head high now because she met her obligations to her lenders.  She is applying for a second loan that she will use to buy more fertilizer for maintaining another recently-planted field.  The first loan improved her life because she had no other way to secure funds for buying the supplies she needed.  Her community bank believed in her and thanks to their confidence, she was able to borrow the funds she needed at a reasonable rate of interest.  She says that she wants to continue her coffee business for as long as God allows her to.  She hopes that she can grow the business and pass it along to her children one day.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her coffee growing business.

loans.name: Joel

texts.es:
Joel es cliente de Kubo Financiero y esta es su historia:

Joel tiene 42 años, es casado desde hace 17 y tiene dos hijos: un hombre de 16 y su niña de 13. Es taxista, y adicionalmente a esto renta 5 departamentos y 3 locales.

Él tiene 9 años dedicándose a estos negocios y le gusta tener varias fuentes de ingreso para no tener problemas de liquidez, por lo que pide este préstamo para poner un nuevo proyecto que tiene en mente: un puesto de comida. 

Gracias al esfuerzo de su trabajo Joel ha logrado comprar una casa, construir una propia y gozar de estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Joel is a client of Kubo Financiero and this is his story:

Joel is 42, he's been married for 17 years, and he has two kids, a 16-year-old boy and a 13-year-old girl.  He is a taxi driver and he also rents out five apartments and three commercial properties.  He has been in these businesses for nine years, and he likes to have several sources of income to avoid liquidity issues.  He requests this loan to start a new project he has in mind - a food stall.  Through his hard work, Joel has been able to buy a house, build his own house, and enjoy financial stability.

loans.use: to start a business selling food, which he has planned

loans.name: Dúo Mariposas De San Bartolo Group

texts.es:
Dúo Mariposas de San Bartolo
Este dúo está conformado por doña Julia Felisa, ella tiene 37 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de abarrotes tales como azúcar, golosinas aguas gaseosas, granos básicos , así como la venta de refacciones y venta de pasteles, ella está solicitando el crédito para la inversión de compra de abarrotes(productos comestibles) para surtir su tienda, así como juegos pirotécnicos para la venta de época navideña, y el resto para venta de refacciones, su propósito es seguir incrementando los ingresos de su casa ya que su anhelo es seguir mejorando las instalaciones de su casa.
texts.en:
Julia Felisa belongs to the Dúo Mariposas de San Bartolo group. She is 37 years old and works selling groceries such as sugar, candy, carbonated water, basic grains, as well as snacks, and pastries. 

She is asking for a loan to invest in the purchase of groceries (provisions) to supply her store as well as fireworks for the Christmas season, and the rest for ingredients for snacks. Her goal is to continue increasing household income and she is yearning to continue making improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy grocery products to sell

loans.name: Dúo Trabajadores De Magdalena Group

texts.es:
Dúo Trabajadores de Magdalena
Este dúo está conformado por don José María, él tiene 30 años de edad y se dedica a la crianza de cerdos,  para destazar y preparar  chicharrones, carnitas y venta de carne d cerdo en su domicilio, ubicado en Magdalena Milpas Altas , él está solicitando el crédito para la compra de lechoncitos  así como concentrado de engorde, con el propósito de mantener siempre en crecimiento ya que anhela creser un poco mas en su negocio,esperando que ustedes le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado
texts.en:
This pair of pig farmers was brought together by Jose Maria, 30 years of age, who raises pigs to use in preparing sausages and pork, which he then sells from his house, located in Magdalena, Milpas Altas.

Jose Maria is requesting a loan to buy suckling pigs plus commercial feed to fatten them. He intends to keep them growing and hopes to increase his business somewhat. Therefore, Jose Maria hopes that you lenders can help fund the loan he is soliciting.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise and sell their meat.

loans.name: Erika Gabriela

texts.es: Erika de 19 años de edad  es madre soltera y habita en casa propia junto a su pequeño hijo de dos años de edad. Erika es muy trabajadora y emprendedora con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado adecuar una pequeña tienda en su hogar de residencia, además por las tardes vende antojitos típicos los cuales son muy demandados por sus clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Erika habita en condiciones muy humildes y desea dar a su hijo condicione más seguras. Desea construir su casa en el terreno heredado por su padre para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de los materiales necesarios como: lámina galvanizada, madera, polines y clavos y así dar inicio a la construcción de su casa lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Erika is 19 years old, single, and lives in her own home with her little two-year-old son. 

Erika is very hard working and enterprising, and through great effort she has been able to open a little store in her home.  Also, in the afternoons she sells traditional snacks, which are very much in demand by her customers, with whom she is more popular every day.

Erika lives in very humble conditions, and she wants to provide her son with conditions that are more secure.  She would like to build her home on land that she inherited from her father, for which she is requesting this loan from FUSAI. 

She will invest it in the purchase of necessary materials, such as galvanized sheeting, wood, poles, and nails, so she can begin building her house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized sheeting, wood, poles, and nails to build a home.

loans.name: Cristo El Salvador Group

texts.es: La Sra. Dora Flores tiene 30 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos y es separada de su pareja; sus niños aún están pequeños y dependen de ella. Lleva 1 año como cliente de Edaprospo y se dedica a la venta de desayuno. Comenzó por medio de sus amistades que le impulsaron a este negocio y abrió su propio negocio como persona independiente tiene aproximadamente 150 clientes diarios y va creciendo de manera frecuente. También tiene negocio de comida por las tardes. Con su trabajo Dora ha logrado darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia ya que ella es el único sustento para sus hijos. Ella cubre los gastos de alimentación, educación, vestimenta y los pagos de servicios de su hogar. Su plan para el futuro es que su negocio siga creciendo y entre en expansión. Ella usa el préstamo para la compra de mercadería. Dora pertenece a la alcancía comunal “Cristo El Salvador”, el cual está conformado por 6 socias y ella lleva el cargo de presidenta
texts.en: Dora Flores is 30 years old.  She has two children and is separated from her partner.  Her children are still young and dependent on her.
